node.title: What to Do This Weekend
node.description: Thaw the turkey, gas up the car.
node.content: ["Welcome. It\u2019s the weekend before Thanksgiving, and for some of us, that means it\u2019s a weekend of preparation. If you\u2019re expecting company, you might be cooking or cleaning. You might be stuffing a turkey or stuffing two years of work-from-home detritus into closets in order to make your place presentable. If you\u2019re traveling, it\u2019s a gas-up-the-car weekend or a try-to-snag-an-aisle-seat weekend. If your bird weighs more than 20 pounds, start thawing it today.", "We\u2019re out of practice with most of this. It might be good to acknowledge that \u2014 especially when the kitchen gets crowded, when you\u2019ve been to two stores looking for heavy cream, when the traffic is terrible. You\u2019ll get it done. You\u2019ll get there.", "Of course, we\u2019re not all in preparation mode. If you\u2019re opting for a low-key holiday (or opting out entirely), you might be reading this newsletter on your phone while waiting in line for Jane Campion\u2019s \u201cThe Power of the Dog,\u201d starring Kirsten Dunst, Jesse Plemons and Benedict Cumberbatch. (It comes to Netflix on Dec. 1.) I\u2019m excited for Mike Mills\u2019s \u201cC\u2019mon C\u2019mon\u201d; I love his previous features \u201cBeginners\u201d and \u201c20th Century Women,\u201d and it\u2019ll be good to get reacquainted with his sensibility.", "A.O. Scott recommends \u201cKing Richard,\u201d a \u201ctwo-for-one superhero origin story\u201d about Venus and Serena Williams, starring Will Smith as their father and the titular potentate. Mindy Kaling\u2019s new series for HBO Max, \u201cThe Sex Lives of College Girls,\u201d looks promising.", "Read Gabrielle Hamilton on downsizing her Thanksgiving from \u201c18 pies, my 32 capons, 50 pounds of mashed potatoes\u201d to \u201cdinner for a small group,\u201d then make her McSorley\u2019s Old Ale House-inspired fried crackers with cheddar and onions. Check out Brittany Luse and Eric Eddings\u2019s reboot of their podcast \u201cFor Colored Nerds.\u201d Check out Adele\u2019s new album, \u201c30.\u201d Look for shooting stars.", "What\u2019s on your mind as we head into the holiday season? What are you thinking, wondering, worrying about, looking forward to? Write us: athome@nytimes.com. Be sure to include your full name and location and we might feature your response in a future newsletter. We\u2019re At Home and Away. We\u2019ll read every letter sent. As always, you\u2019ll find more ideas for leading a full and cultured life, at home and elsewhere, below. I\u2019ll see you on Wednesday.", "Were you forwarded this newsletter? Times subscribers can sign up here to receive it twice a week. There\u2019s more to read, do and watch in our archive. Let us know what you think."]
